id.description: ID of the theme. Must be unique across all other themes.

compatibilityVersion.description: The compatibility version of the theme used by the client to decide whether the theme is compatible with the current app version.

license.description: The license under which the theme can be shared, modified etc.

homepage.description: Website or homepage of the theme.

description.description: A short description of the theme.

colorScheme.description: Whether the theme has a dark color scheme or light.

tags.description: Keywords to help categorize the theme & improve search results.

ThemeDefinition.title: Notesnook Theme schema
ThemeDefinition.description: This is a schema for validation of Notesnook themes.

url.description: Website or support page of the author.

base.description: Base theme scope is the only scope that must be 100% specified. There are no optional variants or colors in this scope and it acts as a fallback for all the other scopes in case a color or variant is missing in them.

statusBar.description: Scope for the status bar on Desktop & mobile. On mobile, the status bar can be found at the bottom of the side navigation menu which includes the sync status, logged in status etc.

list.description: Scope for the central list view containing your notes, notebooks, tags etc.

editor.description: Scope for everything inside the editor excluding the toolbar which has its own scope.

editorToolbar.description: Scope specific to the Editor Toolbar.

editorSidebar.description: Scope for all the Editor side bars include note properties, attachment previews etc.

dialog.description: Scope for all the dialogs in the app.

navigationMenu.description: Scope for the side navigation menu.

contextMenu.description: Scope for all the context menus in the app. This is desktop/web only since the mobile clients do not have context menus.

sheet.description: Scope for all the bottom sheets shown in the app. This scope only applies on the mobile clients & the mobile version of the web app.
